Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Yeah, that's no problem.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Sure. Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam? Knock, knock.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm on the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know you are. Knock, knock.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on the phone] You can fax it over. Yeah, 5-7-0-5-5-5-0-1-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [at same time as Pam] 4-9-1-7-4-5-1

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: 0-1-7-5. Thank you. Bye, bye. [to Michael] It really makes us look unprofessional.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They would never know it was me doing it. Here we go, Knock, knock. [Dwight walks over]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sighs] Who's there?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Buddha.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Buddha who?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [puts a slice of bread and stick of butter on Pam's desk] Buddha this bread for me, won't you? [Michael and Dwight laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I, I need something to wipe my hand.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Now there's, there's butter on my desk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was helping. It was classic.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I got a knock-knock joke.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... God.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, Michael, please, please, please, please, please let me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [clears throat] Knock, knock.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who's there?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: KGB.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: KGB - [Dwight slaps Michael on the face]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in Russian accent] We will ask the questions!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What the hell was that? [Michael starts to fight with Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey! Hey! Stop it! Stop it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You, you like that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: C'mon. What are you doing? Mine was a part of my hilarious joke.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mine was retribution. What are you doing? No more knock-knock jokes. That's it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ding Dong.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Who's there?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: KGB.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, get the door.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not answering it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Answer the door.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ding dong.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No way, it's the KGB.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ding dong.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not answering that. You answer it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna answer it

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna answer it, it's the KGB. [Jim slaps Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The KGB will wait for no one! [Michael laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's true.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Michael walks in dressed as Willy Wonka] Good morning, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no, no, no. I am not Michael. I am Willy Wonkaaaaa.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good morning, Mr. Wonka, here are your messages.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why thank you very much. [notices jelly beans] Oh, what are those? What are those? Tell me, please!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jelly beans.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. They are not just ordinary jelly beans little girl. These are extraordinary jelly beans!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The Willy Wonka Golden Ticket promotional idea is probably the best idea I have ever had. It's probably the best idea anybody has ever had. Three days ago, I slipped five pieces of gold paper into random paper shipments. This entitles the customer to ten percent off of their total order. It will be a day for them that is full of whimsy, and full of excitement and full of fantasy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've written these things because it is my responsibility, as manager of this branch, to profiligate great ideas and I think I have done my part with the golden ticket promotion. Now it is your turn. I want to hear some great ideas from you that are just as good as mine. [Jim raises hand] Umm hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We own our own delivery trucks. We could lease them out on the weekends --

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Too many words. Good ideas are simple. 'Golden ticket.'

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: 'Free paper.'

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Jim. We're a business. Post-its. That is a golden ticket idea. NASA took five or six golden ticket ideas to get man on the moon.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Golden Girls. That's a golden ticket idea, right, I mean how great was that show? Golden Grahams. Another, is it -- I don't get this...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you don't. No, it - [sighs] What will be the state of this company if I am the only one coming up with the great ideas? Right?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think I should call her.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No! No! No!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Why is it so bad for me to call and ask her to lunch today?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sighs] You're making it too easy for her. You're just conveying, 'Oh I like you just the way you are.'

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But I do like her just the way she is.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well that's not what we agreed on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Kevin] Why don't you just go out on a date with her? Try to spark up an on going joke and then in a month or two, if it feels right, you'll know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You don't have to wait that long. I mean, you don't have to wait a month to ask her out. Just ask her out.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're asking him to give up all of his power.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What power?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Andy, Pam, and Jim are all telling me how to deal with this girl that I like, Lynn. I, I don't like getting advice from more than one person at a time. I'm a textbook over-thinker.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You can't let a girl feel good about herself. It will backfire on you. Every compliment has to be backhanded. 'Oh I like your dress, but I'd like it more if you had prettier hair.'

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's psychotic. Do guys actually do that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well guys with girlfriends don't.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's low, Tuna.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey, Tom. What's that? Oh, you found a golden ticket. [puts hand on receiver and speaks to office] One of my clients found a golden ticket. [Michael screams in excitement] [Jim back on phone] Yup. No, congratulations. [Michael dances in background]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Woo hoo.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] I'll take that down right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tell me; was it a spoiled little girl with big lips...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm on the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...or an odd little boy with a cowboy obsession?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hold on one second.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Invite them on the tour.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Michael] It's actually Blue Cross from Pennsylvania.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? That's kind of a big client. [gets up and heads toward Oscar] Hey, Oscar. Woo hoo hoo. Um, how much of a hit is ten percent of our Blue Cross account?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ten percent?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: They're our largest client.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's gonna hurt.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hold on one sec. Hold on one sec, Tom, what's that? You found five golden tickets? And does it say limit one per customer? Nope, it doesn't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How do you not spread out the tickets into different shipments?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I thought I did. So...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well no harm no foul.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: ...well I'm going to call corporate to make sure that they know I didn't lose half my sales.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You didn't, but... it'll be fine. It'll be good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. Hey. Hey. You idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Start over.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sir. I placed a bunch of golden tickets into five separate boxes and some how they all ended up with Blue Cross. How does this happen?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Were the boxes near each other?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Irrelevant.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I put three pallets on the truck to Blue Cross once a week. They use a lot of paper.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, I'm going to ask you something and I want you to be honest. What is a pallet?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My golden ticket idea? OK. Why would anyone think that this is my golden ticket idea? There is a one in 13 chance that this could be anybody's golden ticket idea. [sighs] That... [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Oh hi ,David. [Michael shakes his head to Pam] No, I'm sorry he's not back from the Civil Rights rally. I'll have him call you the minute he gets back from the Lincoln Memorial.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: When Michael's skirting a phone call, he gave me a list of places to say he is. 'Stopping a fight in the parking lot. ' 'An Obama fashion show. ' Whatever... that is. Or 'trapped in an oil painting.' I'm gonna save that one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nobody panic. The good news is... they can't fire all of us, right?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: They can.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, they can't.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes, they can.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oscar, you don't know what the hell you are talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, what do you think shutting down a branch is?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, then we're screwed. I am just a net that traps all of your crappy subconscious ideas and adds a little bit of my own childhood memories and whimsy, so -

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, well I lost a ton of money today and I have a mortgage, so I'm a little pissed too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you, Jim is with me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely not, I'm mad at you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well you know what Jim? It is not my fault that you bought a house to impress Pam. That is why carnations exist.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: That's not why.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, we need a gold ticket idea to get us out of this mess. [Pam raises hand] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Does that mean an idea that blows up in our faces later? [Pam's phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, don't get that. Please? [Pam gets up to answer her phone]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I've got a golden ticket idea. Why don't you skip on up to the roof and jump off?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is not constructive.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Oh hi, David. He's having a colonoscopy. Alright, I'll find out if he's out yet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hello David. I just got back from my procedure, so-

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [on speaker phone] Michael, what the hell is going on here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Fine. What is going on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [reading from computer] My colonoscopy was an examination of my large colon and the distal part of my small bowel with a camera.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Why did you OK this golden ticket idea? We're going to lose a fortune, Michael. How could you let this happen?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, there is an explanation that involves me not letting it happen and I just don't... I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: How could you not know Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think we might have hired an outside marketing consultant.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Might have hi-- OK, what firm?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're breaking up.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, I think, it might have been an inside consultant.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Was it the sales department?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Was it Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: OK, was it Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [long pause] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Dwight walks in] Come on in. Good to see ya, have a seat. I just wanted to congratulate you on that great golden ticket idea.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That was your idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Woah, wow, who told you that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You did. Several times. Over and over again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [same time as Dwight] No, I don't think I ever did. That was your idea Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [same time as Michael] You were dressed as Willy Wonka so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not taking... I'm not taking...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wasn't my idea. Loved - but I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait a second, wait a second, I wrote it down in my diary.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You don't keep a diary.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes I do. You've just never seen it. [reading from diary] March 4th. Dwight came up with the best idea today about golden tickets.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hold that thought. [Dwight gets up and gets own diary from desk and returns] [flipping through diary] March... 4th. Michael Scott came up with golden ticket idea to give five customers ten perfect off for one year.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why do you have a diary?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: To keep secrets from my computer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, you know what? You came up with this idea. I remember you told me that you loved the Willy Wonka movie when you were growing up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Impossible.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, you did.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I wasn't given candy as a child, so a movie that fetish-ized it that much, would have made no sense to me. Plus, we weren't allowed to see movies. So... do the math.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you writing? [Dwight writes in diary]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Had conversation with Michael about taking credit for an idea that wasn't mine. Discussed movies.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would you like to go to lunch with me? Just the two of us?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: With all my heart.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You guys are throwing a lot at me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All I'm saying is that it's a first dates, so just keep a respectful distance.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think Jim means to say that you shouldn't touch her.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, that is what I mean.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Shush. [to Kevin] Kevin, a playful touch on the arm, or on the back, it can show your interest and it's really romantic.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [puts hand on Jim's hand] Like that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Don't touch her. Don't talk to her. Don't look at her.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Jim, Andy and Pam all talking over each other] ...turn into this black and carbon brick-where this barbeque sauce of shame and rage and two hot people with a perfect relationship would not understand that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We think a lot alike. Sometimes you will think something and I will say what you're thinking-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, what am I thinking right now?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Umm, nacho chips.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No... How skin is the largest organ of the body.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, OK. Let me just cut to the chase, Dwight. I want you to fall on your sword for me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, not gonna happen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I did fall on my sword once. I was running with it in my belt. Won't happen again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why do you even want to stay at Dunder Mifflin? I mean what's the point? You're cooped up in there all day. You don't get to do your farming. You're not dating Angela anymore. It doesn't matter if you get fired for taking credit for the gold ticket idea. It doesn't matter. Me on the other hand, I would be lost without this place. You, way too manly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What about Shoe La La?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] It's not ready yet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have an idea for a fancy men's shoe store called Shoe La La. And it's just men's shoes for the special occasions in a man's life, like the day that you get married or the day your wife has a baby, or for just lounging around the house.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: May I have your attention please. I have an announcement. Mr. Dwight Schrute and I just returned from a wonderful stroll together and although I probably will never do it again, I had fun. I really had fun with my best friend, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: These aren't announcements.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes they are, you just don't care about the information.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I love working here and I do not want to leave.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He doesn't love it that much. Wouldn't be such a bad thing for him to be fired.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I mean, like we were talking about that is why he has come to the conclusion...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We discussed the fact that I'm cooped up here instead of experiencing the whole wide world.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No plowing my own acres. Going around shirtless all day. You know experiencing freedom.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's it. That's it. You can't put a price on freedom.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Try me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's why you made the decision. That's why you made...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I haven't made a decision yet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You kind of have.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You cannot take the fall for him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He said he would do the same for me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He can do the same for you. Right now. By getting fired instead of you. So what are you gonna do?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm gonna go back to work. After I write you up for insubordination.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There it is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [seeing David Wallace come into the office] Oh my God. Dwight! Dwight! Get in-- what's it gonna be, what are you gonna do? [Dwight runs into Michael's office] What's it gonna be? Are you gonna do this thing for me? Dwight? [David knocks on Michael's door and opens door] Hey David, how are you? Good to see you. Nice surprise. Dwight and I were just having a very unfortunate conversation.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: That's too bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes it is, but it had to be done, didn't it?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hopefully, nothing that can't be undone because Dwight I owe you an apology. The head of Blue Cross just called. They were so excited about the golden ticket discount that they have decided to make Dunder Mifflin their exclusive provider of all office supplies. Congratulations Dwight. [holds out hand for handshake]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: David... you're welcome. [Dwight and David shake hands and make exclamations]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I just want to say that this golden ticket idea is one of the most brilliant signs of initiative I have ever seen at this company and how about a big round of applause for Mr. Dwight Schrute? [everyone starts clapping]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Alright Dwight. This is huge.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's what she said! [David laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight, great idea. Dwight, Dwight, great idea. How'd you come up with that idea?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Inspiration.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? How did- how are you inspired? How did it pop into your head Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [same time as Michael] You never know when it's gonna strike. Just... boom.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give me the details of how that happened.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You, you are taking about Dwight Schrute. The biggest Wonka fan I know. I mean, you've been talking about that movie for years.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And you know what? I even made fun of you when you dressed up as Willy Wonka to pitch this idea and for that I apologize.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Apology rejected.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [going up to give Dwight a hug] Thanks for much for helping the company, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Good work, kid.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thanks old man.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: This, this is great. OH, OK, look I want to get you on the horn with the marketing people in New York. The should meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Pam, could you set up a call in there in about 15 minutes, please?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: David? David?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [same time as Michael] 'Cause I've got this idea...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: David?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Could I be a part of the meeting also?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You probably have too much to do around here. I don't want to uh, take up your time with another meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, let's face it. This meeting sounds like it's Wonka fans only. He's never seen the movie. [David laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone] Hey guys, I have with me Dwight Schrute. Dwight, take it away.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK guys, listen up. Here's the deal. I love candy. Sweet sugary candy from the second it touches my tongue to the moment it's metabolized by my stomach acids, so naturally I liked Willy Wonka.

Quote.Speaker: Man on phone
Quote.Text: Wait, do you guys hear that? There's not a dog listening in, is there? [cut to show Michael on the other line] I hear panting.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No. No dogs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So I love Willy Wonka. That golden ticket scene is so inspiring to me that that's where I cam up with that idea [Michael comes into conference room].

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There is no movie called Willy Wonka. It's called Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's actually based on a book called Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't... vouch for that. But I do know this. He is a liar. He has taken my idea.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is my idea.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [on phone] We are gonna call you back guys. [to Michael] What is going on here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, here's what happened, David. It was all my idea. You called me and you were really angry at me and I got scared, so I had Dwight take the fall, but now, it turns out that it's a great idea and Dwight will not confess. Can you believe that?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No, no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is my idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh how dare you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is my idea. I'm filled with good ideas. Thousands of good ideas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are? Good ideas, huh? Hey, did you come up with toilet buddy? It's a net, circular net, that you put inside the toilet to catch all of your change and your wallet from falling into the toilet? Formally known as toilet guard?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Horse Boat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh please.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A canoe built around your horse so you can go from riding to water travel without slowing down. Horse Boat!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toilet sponge. It's a hollowed out sponge...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh give me a break.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...that is more absorbent, and softer than toilet paper. I have a lot of toilet ideas.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's because they're easy!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They're not easy. Everybody has to go to the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [same time as Michael] Women's urinals... uh...

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [same time as Michael and Dwight] Guys, guys. OK, enough. Please, enough. What, is this true, Dwight? I mean, is this true?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, it's Michael's idea that he forced on me on threat of death.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank You!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: What, I don't -- what do you want me to do now, Michael? What am I supposed to do now?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well David, I will be honest with you. I do want the credit without any of the blame.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: OK, uhh... I am going back to New York. Pam, do me a favor, don't send me those notes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I am gone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When they look back on this day in the history books all that will be remembered is that I had a good idea. And that's what I am going to write down in my diary. That is what I want you to write down in yours.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh I am. In my own words.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want to see it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want to see it. [Michael gets up to try to see Dwight's diary]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give me... Give me the diary.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! [Michael struggles to take Dwight's diary from his hand]

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Lynn, I'm just gonna say to you everything that I am thinking.

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think you have the best smile. I'd like to take you out to dinner and a movie.

Quote.Speaker: Lynn
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice. [Both laugh] Boobs. [Lynn blushes]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, it's uh, his funeral. So... neh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ding dong.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who is it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: KGB.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. I just got out of the shower, I'll be one second.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in accent] When you are done, open the door. ... Hello in there?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm late for work, so I have to brush my teeth, it's a whole routine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We have more houses to visit.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If you want to come back then, that'll be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We will come back at... how is [looks at watch] 4:45?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I get back from work around 6.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How about 5:15?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You can try. That, that might work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very well, we will come back at 5:15.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.
